pageContext.claim: “We want to talk about a country [North Korea] that has misbehaved for many, many years -- decades, actually -- through numerous administrations.  And they didn't want to take on the issue, and I have no choice but to take it on, and I'm taking it on.”
pageContext.analysis: The Clinton, Bush and Obama administrations did try to deal with the North Korean issue. Clinton struck a deal, which Bush abandoned but then tried to negotiate a new one. Obama did not want to launch talks by making new concessions, as Bush did, so progress stalled.
